item.title: sympo: Point Cloud Processing
item.description:
Neural Depth

  • GPU-Accelerated 3D Point Cloud Processing with Hierarchical GMM

    Code

    Video: GTC Silicon Valley-2019: GPU-Accelerated 3D Point Cloud Processing with Hierarchical Gaussian Mixtures

    Found by DDG (image) with searching the paper: “GPU-Accelerated LOD Generation for Point Clouds”

Visualization

  • GPU-Accelerated LOD Generation for Point Clouds

    Code | Bernhard Kerbl (3DGS) | CoolPapers

    • CudaLOD
    • Multi-level details for point cloud

Refinement

(2024-03-15)

Journey when searching: “point cloud refinement research” DDG

  1. Real-Time Point Cloud Refinement

    RSGate (2024-03-16)

    • Upsampiling point cloud by inserting new point set
    • Splatting

  1. A voxel-based multiview point cloud refinement method via factor graph optimization

    No Code | Paper not accessible

    It’s compared with ICP, ICP-Normal, GICP, LUM, BALM

Search the title of above paper 1 DDG

  1. PR-GCN: A Deep Graph Convolutional Network With Point Refinement for 6D Pose Estimation (ICCV 2021)

    Semantic

    (2024-03-16)

    • KNN and Graph Convolution Network

Edge-aware

The paper-1 is cited by:

  1. Ec-net: an edge-aware point set consolidation network

    Code

item.title: sympo: Complete Point Clouds
item.description:
Explore

(2024-02-24)

DDG search: “point cloud fusion”, found the wikipedia page of “Point cloud”, where the caption of the illustration 3 mentioned: “reconstructing 3D shapes from multi-view depth map”. That picture is from:

  1. Synthesizing 3D Shapes via Modeling Multi-View Depth Maps and Silhouettes with Deep Generative Networks ~ CVPR 2017

    Code | Amir A. Soltani, Jiajun Wu

Then I searched the paper’s title in DDG , and I found:

  1. Render4Completion: Synthesizing Multi-View Depth Maps for 3D Shape Completion ~ ICCV 2019 workshop

    Arxiv | CoolPapers | Tao Hu, Zhizhong Han, Matthias Zwicker

    • Data: Render multi-view depth maps for incomplete object

    • Train: 8-view incomplete depth map -> NN -> 8-view completed depth map

    • 3D shape: Unproject 8 depth maps

  1. Learning Implicit Fields for Generative Shape Modeling ~ CVPR 2019

    Arxiv | Zhiqin Chen, Hao Zhang, SFU

  1. Improved Modeling of 3D Shapes with Multi-view Depth Maps ~ 3DV 2020

    Code | CoolPapers | Kamal Gupta, Matthias Zwicker

    • single view
    • GAN

item.title: sympo: Point Cloud from Depth Maps
item.description:
Depth Completion

Depth Completion - Paper with code

  • Learning Guided Convolutional Network for Depth Completion

    Arxiv | Code | CoolPapers | Jie Tang, Ping Tan

    (2024-02-21)

    • Dynamic convolution kernel

Depth Super-Resolution

  • PatchFusion: An End-to-End Tile-Based Framework for High-Resolution Monocular Metric Depth Estimation

    Code | ProjPage | Zhenyu Li, Peter Wonka

    (2024-02-23)

  • Joint Implicit Image Function for Guided Depth Super-Resolution ~ ACM MM 2021

    Code | Arxiv | Jiaxiang Tang

    (2024-02-22)

item.title: read: Point-MVSNet
item.description:
Code | Arxiv | Oral | GScholar | Rui Chen, Hao Su

Notes

(2023-12-24)

Abs & Intro

Use point cloud to refine depth map rather than regularizing (“squashing”) cost volumes.

Refine the coarse point cloud by iteratively estimating the residual from the current depth to the target depth.

feature volume ➔ feature-augmented point cloud ➔ depth residual ➔ point displacement

Output: a dense point cloud, as opposed to sparse point cloud from SfM used by 3DGS.

Depth map yielded from point cloud representation doesn’t suffer from the problem of resolution limitation.

Optimization objective: minimize the distance from point to the surface, with the supervision of depth map

  • Depth estimation doesn’t involve opacity for rendering, so can the RGB appearance be used as loss function?

PointFlow: Move point towards the surface. 3DGS split or clone a Gaussian along the position’s gradient with some hyper-parameters setting.

How is the generalizability of this method?

Pipeline

  1. Point cloud initialization from a small coarse depth map for reference image.

    • 48 homographies (depths) for warping a source feature map with the 1/8 size of the original image.

  2. Assign 2D and 3D context feature to each point

    • 2D feature: project each point onto 3-level feature maps of each view with camera focals and cx,cy scaled.

      The retrieved feature vectors of N views are merged into a variance for a certain level j of the feature maps:

      $$𝐂ʲ = \frac{\sum (𝐅ʲ - \bar{𝐅ʲ}) }{N}$$

      • Only the feature vectors at the projection locations are taken, rather than processing the entire feature map, thereby improving efficiency.

    • 3D feature: normalized point coordinates $𝐗ₚ$

    • Concatenate features: $Cₚ = 𝐂¹ ⊕ 𝐂² ⊕ 𝐂³ ⊕ 𝐗ₚ$

  3. Define displacement steps with point hypotheses.

    The unprojected 3D point cloud from 2D depth map is determined. The displacement direction has a lot of freedom. Thus, each point is confined to move along the ray emitted from the reference camera. Such that the per-pixel depth can be refined.

    • In the above figure, • is a real point, and o is a point hypothesis $\tilde{𝐩ₖ}$ associated with a read point $𝐩ₖ$:

      $$\tilde{𝐩ₖ} = 𝐩ₖ + k s 𝐭, \quad k = -m, …, m$$

      where k is the number of steps, s is the step size along the ray direction 𝐭.

    m = 1, so

  4. Aggreate features of the n nearest neighbors

    Use Dynamic Graph CNN to aggreate neighboring points

  5. Use a MLP to map the aggregated feature to probabilities of point hypotheses.

    The PointFlow module requires iterations to approach the surface.

    The predicted depth residual against the target depth is a probabilistic weighted sum (expectation) of all predefined hypothetical steps.

    $$Δdₚ = 𝐄(ks) = ∑_{k=-m}^m ks × Prob( \tilde{𝐩ₖ} )$$

  6. Upsampling the refined depth map and shrink the interval between point hypotheses.

  7. Loss: Accumulated absolute error between refined depth map and the ground-truth depth map over all previous iterations.

    $$L = ∑_{i=0}^l \Big( \frac{1}{s^{(i)}} ∑_{p∈𝐏_{valid}} \| 𝐃_{GT}(p) - 𝐃^{(i)}(p) \|₁ \Big)$$

Method

Feature concatenation is similar to PixelNeRF: point ocoordinates + feature vectors. But here the points position isn’t consistent resulting in that different feature vectors are sampled on the feature pyrimid.

As the 2D CNN also requires optimization, the feature pyrimid is changingas well.

Play

Environment

(2023-12-26)

Installation on Lambda server (Ubuntu 18.04.6 LTS, nvcc -V return 10.2, Driver Version: 470.103.01):

1
2

bash install_dependencies.sh
bash compile.sh

Error: No CUDA runtime is found, using CUDA_HOME='/usr/local/cuda'

  File "/home/zichen/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/_vendor/packaging/version.py", line 264, in __init__
    match = self._regex.search(version)
TypeError: expected string or bytes-like object

  1. Search the error with DDG.

    • torch.cuda.is_available() returns False. NV forums

    • pytorch is of cpu version. issue

      1
2
3
4
5

      >>> conda list
cpuonly          2.0         0    pytorch
pytorch          1.10.2      py3.6_cpu_0    pytorch
pytorch-mutex    1.0         cpu    pytorch
torchvision      0.11.3      py36_cpu  [cpuonly]  pytorch

  2. Reinstall with newer packages:

    “install_dependencies.sh”:

    1
2
3
4
5

 conda create -n PointMVSNet python=3.10
 source activate PointMVSNet
 conda install pytorch==1.12.1 torchvision==0.13.1 cudatoolkit=10.2 -c pytorch
 conda install -c anaconda pillow
 pip install -r requirements.txt

/home/zichen/anaconda3/envs/PointMVSNet/lib/python3.10/site-packages/torch/include/c10/core/SymInt.h(84): warning: integer conversion resulted in a change of sign

/home/zichen/anaconda3/envs/PointMVSNet/lib/python3.10/site-packages/torch/include/ATen/Context.h(25): warning: attribute "__visibility__" does not apply here

csrc/gather_knn_kernel.cu(34): error: identifier "AT_CHECK" is undefined

csrc/gather_knn_kernel.cu(106): error: identifier "AT_CHECK" is undefined

csrc/gather_knn_kernel.cu(125): error: identifier "THArgCheck" is undefined

csrc/gather_knn_kernel.cu(145): error: identifier "THCudaCheck" is undefined

csrc/gather_knn_kernel.cu(84): error: identifier "TH_INDEX_BASE" is undefined

5 errors detected in the compilation of "/tmp/tmpxft_00002cb5_00000000-6_gather_knn_kernel.cpp1.ii".
error: command '/usr/local/cuda/bin/nvcc' failed with exit code 1

    Perplexity (GPT4): Identifiers have been deprecated after PyTorch 1.0.

    In PyTorch 1.5.0 and later, AT_CHECK has been replaced with TORCH_CHECK. Similarly, THArgCheck and THCudaCheck are no longer used in newer versions of PyTorch. The identifier TH_INDEX_BASE is also undefined because it’s no longer used in PyTorch 1.0 and later.

  3. Downgrade pytorch:

    AI葵 used torch 1.4. Issue: “TH_INDEX_BASE” is undefined #1

    1
2
3
4
5
6

     #!/usr/bin/env bash
 conda create -n PointMVSNet python=3.8
 source activate PointMVSNet
 conda install pytorch==1.4.0 torchvision==0.5.0 cudatoolkit=10.1 -c pytorch
 conda install -c anaconda pillow
 pip install -r requirements.txt

    torchvision older than v0.6.1 doesn’t exist in conda:

  - torchvision==0.5.0

Current channels:

  - https://conda.anaconda.org/pytorch/linux-64

looking for, navigate to

    https://anaconda.org

and use the search bar at the top of the page.

  4. Use pip to install torch 1.4. (perplexity)

    1
2
3
4
5

    conda create -n PointMVSNet python=3.8
source activate PointMVSNet
conda install -c anaconda pillow
pip install torch==1.4.0 torchvision==0.5.0
pip install -r requirements.txt

    And modify TH_INDEX_BASE -> 0 in “gather_knn_kernel.cu”.

    It can be compiled successfully.

    • 3DGS also has knn code

Train & Eval

  • Place the dataset (DTU) in the specified directory:

    1
2

    mkdir data
ln -s /home/zichen/Downloads/mvs_training/dtu/ ./data

  • Training for 16 epochs cost 3 days approximately:

    1
2

    export CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=4,5,6,7
python pointmvsnet/train.py --cfg configs/dtu_wde3.yaml

  • Evaluate

    The “Recified” dataset can’t be download from the official site by clicking the link. It may be due to broswer limitations as the zip file is 123 GB (analyzed by Perplexity).

    Wget works: wget http://roboimagedata2.compute.dtu.dk/data/MVS/Rectified.zip
